The Fractional Lethal Dose (FLD) for agent ”i” is given by:
$$FLD_i = C_i \times \Delta_t/Di$$ If the exposure is over a long duration and the concentration varies over time then:

$$FLDi = \sum_k {{(C_{i,k} \times \Delta_k)} \over D_i}$$

$$FLDi = \sum_k {{(C_{i,k} \times \Delta_k)} \over D_i}$$

$$FICN = {{{e ^{CN/43} } \over 220}-0.0045} \times t$$

$$FICN = {{{{e ^{CN/43} } \over 220}-0.0045} \over 60} \times (PET_{current}-PET_{last})$$
